III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was slammed against a wall by Staff 1 during an
escalated incident.
Investigation The Complainant was interviewed on 08/16/2024 and had no
additional information to provide.
The Chief Administrator was interviewed on 06/18/2024 during
an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She clarified the
staff involved in the incident and documentation was provided.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 06/18/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He
recalled the incident in question occurring because he was fighting
another youth and had to be restrained by staff. He believed his
head was thrown into a wall as this occurred. Youth A recalled
staff members being present and trying to break up the fight
between he and Youth E. Youth A also recalled Staff 1 and
Supervisor 1 getting involved to break up the fight. Youth A stated
Staff 1 restrained him from behind and that was when he stopped
attempting to fight with Youth E. Youth A believed Staff 1
slammed him from behind into the wall three to four times. He
recalled more of this part of the incident, stating he attempted to
hit Staff 1 by swinging his arms behind him as Staff 1 was
attempting to restrain him. Youth A stated he was fighting and
attempting to get out of the restraint. Youth A believed he
accidentally head-butted Staff 1 by swinging his own head
2

backwards. Youth A had some superficial scratches on his
forehead at the time of the interview. He stated these could have
come from being slammed into the wall, but they also could have
been caused by the fight he was in that preceded being
restrained. Youth A also believed he could have caused the
scratches himself, he stated he often scratches his forehead.
Youth A stated he was unsure of any other times when he had
been restrained with improper procedures.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 07/11/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth B
stated he heard the commotion of Youth A and Youth E fighting
and saw that Youth A had to be restrained and placed in his room,
but he could not recall any significant details.
Youth C was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 07/11/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated
he saw some of the incident in question despite being told to go
back to the pod as it was occurring. Youth C recalled staff getting
in between Youth A and Youth E to break up the fight. Youth C
recalled seeing Youth A get restrained and moved down the
hallway. He stated he never saw Youth A get slammed to the
floor or the wall, and he did not see any punches thrown by either
Youth A or Staff 1, but he did recall seeing Youth A struggle and
fight the restraint attempt.
Youth D was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 07/11/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He
recalled that a staff member, of which he could not remember their
name, was in the hallway near their unit when a fight broke out
between two other youth, Youth A and Youth E. Youth D stated
he did not see much more of what occurred in the hallway but did
see when Youth A was escorted back to the unit. Youth D
believed that Youth A and Staff 1 collided with the door of Youth
A’s unit as they were moving back, and Youth A was fighting the
escort restraint. Youth D stated the incident ended when Youth A
was placed in his room by Staff 1. Youth D did not believe any
punches were thrown. Youth D did not believe he saw any
injuries to Youth A.
Youth E was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 07/11/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He
recalled being in a fight in the hallway with Youth A on the date in
question. He did not believe he witnessed anything else involving
Youth A after the fight was broken up and clarified that he did not
see Youth A get escorted down the hallway afterwards.
3

Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 07/11/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She
stated she arrived at the location of the incident after Youth A and
Youth E had fought each other. Both of the youth were continuing
to yell and threaten each other at this point. As Youth A
attempted to reach over staff to try to continue to fight Youth E, he
was restrained by Staff 1. Staff 1 then escorted Youth A down the
hallway toward the pod. Staff 2 stated she was focused more on
Youth E and did not see the entirety of Staff 1’s restraint and
escort of Youth A. She did recall Youth A continuing to threaten
and yell, but she did not believe she saw him struggle against
Staff 1. She did not recall seeing Youth A get slammed into the
wall by Staff 1. She did recall seeing Staff 1 hold Youth A’s hands
behind him as he walked him down the hall. Staff 2 confirmed she
did not see anything after Youth A and Staff 1 entered the pod to
go to his room. Staff 2 recalled she never heard Youth A remark
he was in pain nor did she witness any injuries to him.
During a video conference on 07/22/2024 DHHS Worker 1
provided an update on her investigation and was not able to state
a final result at that time.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 07/29/2024. He
stated he was involved in the incident in question. Supervisor 1
recalled Youth A and Youth E fighting and that requiring staff to
get involved to break it up. He stated Staff 1 focused on Youth A,
and he focused on Youth E. Youth A was continuing to try to fight
so Staff 1 had to escort him down the hallway. Supervisor 1
stated he did not see the entirety of the interaction between Youth
A and Staff 1 because of his effort to help de-escalate Youth E.
Supervisor 1 stated he did not see anything suspicious between
Staff 1 and Youth A, from what he did see. Supervisor 1 stated he
did see Staff 1 holding Youth A by his hands behind Youth A’s
back in an attempt to hold him back from attacking Youth E further
as well as escorting him down the hallway. Supervisor 1 also
stated he saw Youth A up against a wall at one point, but pointed
out that he believed it was Youth A’s momentum that took both
Youth A and Staff 1 to the wall, and Youth A was not pressed up
against the wall in a manner that would possibly injure him.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 08/09/2024. He stated
his involvement in the incident began with attempting to separate
Youth A and Youth E from each other as they fought in a hallway.
Staff 1 recalled other staff attempting to de-escalate and restrain
Youth E as he did the same with Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A
4

was still significantly escalated as this occurred. Staff 1 attempted
to escort Youth A down the hallway and there was more than one
point where Youth A and he bumped up against the walls of the
hallway. Staff 1 stated this was not intentional and was more
caused by Youth A’s escalation and difficulty in holding him back
than anything else. Staff 1 stated Youth A was never slammed
against a wall, and he never had any concern over Youth A’s
ability to breath or receiving injuries. He stated he knew this
because Youth A never commented on about struggling to breath
or being hurt.
Nurse 1 was interviewed over the phone on 08/16/2024. She
stated she assessed Youth A after the incident occurred, but she
did not witness the incident itself. Nurse 1 recalled Youth A
stating to her he started a fight in an effort to try to break out of the
facility. Youth A would not comment to her which staff restrained
him. Nurse 1 recalled Youth A had only injuries of superficial
scratches on his forehead. Youth A commented that he might
have caused them himself, but they also might’ve been caused by
the incident. Nurse 1 also commented that Youth A’s story of the
incident changed as he spoke to her about the incident,
specifically in how many times he felt he was “slammed” against
the wall during the incident and in how he received the superficial
scratches on his forehead.
Video reviewed:
• Security footage for the 06/17/2024 incident was provided
and reviewed. The footage captured the hallway where the
incident occurred. Youth A and Youth E were seen
fighting, and staff came to attempt to break up the fight.
Within a minute Youth A was separated from Youth E by
Staff 1 and escorted down the hallway. The footage then
flipped to the other end of the hallway heading to the door
of the unit. Staff 1 was holding Youth A’s arms from behind
as they both walked towards the doorway. Youth A was
seen struggling against the restraint, and at one point he
stepped toward a wall. Youth A’s head and face never
appeared to touch the wall, only his chest. Youth A then
turned back towards the end of the hallway where the
incident occurred and attempted to pull away from Staff 1.
Youth A and Staff 1 then lunge into the same wall, and then
Staff 1 was able to turn back towards the end of the
hallway. Youth A continued to struggle and in doing so
they both turned towards the opposite wall and slammed
into it. Youth A continued to struggle against the hold of
Staff 1 while they both were able to move through the
5

doorway at the end of the hallway. As that occurred Youth
E was seen rushing towards them and was stopped by
staff. Youth E then walked back the other way. In the
second video Youth A was seen being escorted back to his
room by Staff 1 and being placed in his room for the use of
seclusion after the incident.
Documents reviewed:
• Unusual Incident Report Summary dated 06/18/2024
regarding the 06/17/2024 incident was provided and
reviewed. Information documented was consistent with
interviews provided.
• Medical Assessment/Progress note dated 06/17/2024 and
authored by Nurse 1 was provided and reviewed. It was
documented that Youth A reported having his head
slammed against the wall three or four times to Nurse 1.
• Staff 1’s personnel file was reviewed. He had been trained
on the facility’s restraint model on 04/09/2024 and verbal
de-escalation procedures on 02/08/2024.
• Facility policy on physical management was provided and
reviewed. The facility’s policy stated that restraints may be
used when the youth is in the act of assaulting other
persons and jeopardizing the safety of others.
• Facility policy on youth discipline and behavior
management was provided and reviewed. This
documentation outlined prohibited conduct from staff to
youth, including any type of physical discipline.
Analysis The facility was found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and video and documentation review. There was no
evidence found that Youth A was slammed into a wall specifically
because of Staff 1's effort during the incident in question.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
